report_title: Industry Research: Home Improvement Stores in the US
executive_summary: The home improvement stores industry is very mature and dominated by two major companies, Home Depot and Lowe's. Both companies share similar product lines and high levels of price competition. Home improvement stores serve various markets, including do-it-for-me (DIFM), do-it-yourself (DIY), and professional. Most demand for products offered by home improvement stores is derived from activity in the residential market.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Demand for Home Improvements Grew Through COVID
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: During the COVID-19 period, the residential sector experienced rapid demand stemming from low interest rates. Even through 2020, as COVID-19 swept through the US, demand for flooring remained heightened. High per capita disposable income met with increased investment into home improvement bolstered demand for home improvement stores.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Home Improvement Stores are so Tied to Residential Sector Growth, Rising Interest Rates Crushed Demand for Housing That Year, Leading to Faltering Revenue
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Inflationary issues are expected to remain through 2023; despite this, home improvement store revenue is expected to grow at a CAGR of 3.8% to $258.6 billion, with a 2.5% decrease in 2023 alone, when profit margins are estimated to climb to 14.2%. Moving forward, interest rate hikes are anticipated to remain a major problem for home improvement stores.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: THE INDUSTRY REMAINS CONCENTRATED, BENEFITTING PLAYERS AT THE TOP
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The concentration of home improvement takes place up at the top. Major players, Home Depot and Lowe's, take up more than 70% of industry revenue. Home Depot and Lowe's have been able to leverage several favorable circumstances for their company.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: A GROWING URBAN AND SUBURBAN POPULATION IN TEXAS BOLSTERED DEMAND FOR HOME IMPROVEMENTS STORES
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Companies in the industry tend to locate themselves in densely populated areas to maximize their consumer base. This is why California leads the nation in establishments. However, recently, due to many reasons, cities and suburbs in Texas have seen heightened migration during the period. This resulted in Texas becoming the second largest state for establishment concentration across the US.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: FALLING INTEREST RATES ARE EXPECTED TO SPUR DOWNSTREAM DEMAND
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Residential and nonresidential are the two crucial downstream market indicators for home improvement stores.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Changes in Age Demographics Will Shift Demand for Home Improvement Stores
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Home improvement stores rely heavily on demand from Do-it-yourself customers (DIY), and a large chunk of DIY customers are baby boomers, given their heightened availability of free time. However, by the end of 2028, baby boomer-aged consumers are expected to exit the DIY industry as they age.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Growing Disposable Income is Expected to Support the Industry
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Another crucial indicator of demand is per capita disposable income levels. Many adverse macroeconomic trends plaguing the consumer in the previous period are expected to diminish. As a result, per capita disposable income is expected to grow. This jump in disposable income may push consumers to upgrade their home appliances for something of higher quality.

market_segmentation.segment_description: This category consists of repair and remodeling contractors, landscapers, property managers and maintenance professionals. Professionals will often purchase various products from home improvement stores and carry out services for consumers and businesses.

This category consists of consumers that purchase floor coverings, such as tiles and rugs and complete the work themselves. With per capita disposable income expected to rise through 2023, do-it-yourself is likely to grow as a result. Additionally, during COVID-19, do-it-yourself became the most popular method for home improvement since in-person work was made much more difficult due to social distancing orders.

products_and_services.product_or_service: Lumber and Other Building and Structural Materials
products_and_services.product_description: This segment consists of varying types of structural materials, including dimensional lumber, untreated and treated lumber, boards, engineered wood products, glue-lam and laminated veneer lumber, connectors, joist hangers, tie-downs, floor trusses, roof trusses and framed wall panels. The lumber segment increased drastically as builders needed more to meet the demand for new housing in 2020.

products_and_services.product_or_service: Household Appliances, Kitchen Goods and Housewares
products_and_services.product_description: This segment contains household appliances, kitchen goods and houseware. During the pandemic, consumers spent the majority of the work week and their free time at home. This, in turn, spurred growth in home improvements. Included in this home improvement was the purchasing of new appliances and other goods to furnish the home. Private spending on home improvements has declined over the past five years due to higher interest rates, resulting in customers refraining from purchasing new appliances.

products_and_services.product_or_service: Lawn, Garden and Farm Equipment Supplies
products_and_services.product_description: In addition to lawn, garden and farm machinery and equipment, this segment also includes fertilizer, animal feed, cut flowers, potted plants and nursery stock. Home gardeners and homeowners trying out a new hobby looked to gardening as most Americans were required to remain home.

products_and_services.product_or_service: Hardware, Tools and Plumbing and Electrical Supplies
products_and_services.product_description: This segment includes hardware, ladders, hand tools and power tools, in addition to plumbing, electrical, wiring and welding supplies. COVID-19 caused some significant demand increases for this segment, and the initial boost in demand was met almost solely by large home improvement stores. However, as time moved on and specialty stores got their footing, many customers went there for a larger product offering as well as more specialized knowledge of the intricacies of the specific segment.

demand_determinants.determinant_description: Increased leisure time bolstered demand for lawn, gardening and farm equipment as consumers turned towards those activities to pass lockdown time. Besides, lumber and household experienced the greatest degree of demand during COVID-19.

Rising interest rates have lowered the ability of companies to expand operations, halting concentration for major players. Increased specialization in big-box stores bolsters concentration, taking away demand from the smaller sub-industries related to home improvements.

Large home improvement stores saw massive demand during 2020 as consumers boosted spending on home improvements and other residential-related spending. Strong sales growth for Home Depot led to a huge hiring wave in spring 2022. Overall, Home Depot was looking to hire over 100,000 new employees, exemplifying their success throughout the year.

business_locations.location_description: Touting the largest share of the US population, the Southeast offers massive downstream markets for home improvement stores to serve. Generally, the greater amount of people in each area, the greater demand will be from the residential sector. Florida alone holds a high concentration of home improvement stores, benefitting from the rapidly growing cities, as well as a strong business sector.

Also benefitting from significant downstream markets, California holds the highest concentration of stores across all states. Offering the largest, fastest-growing downstream residential market, California is the cash cow of the region for home improvement stores.

The Southwest region holds a high percentage of home improvement stores. During this period, the high cost of living in cities across other regions has pushed consumers to relocate to cheaper cities that are on the rise. In Texas, Austin, Dallas and Houston have been popular cities for people to move to, boosting the population and thus attracting more home improvement stores.

regulations_points.regulation_title: THE SHERMAN, CLAYTON AND ROBINSON-PATMAN ACTS
regulations_points.regulation_description: These three acts form a baseline for antitrust issues surrounding many US industries. These three acts work together to prohibit monopolies and price discrimination and protect smaller independent business owners.
Minimum wage, overtime and other working conditions fall under this act. It is important for companies that operate in several states to understand the differences there may be.

regulations_points.regulation_title: THE FEDERAL CONSUMER CREDIT PROTECTION ACT
regulations_points.regulation_description: Since several companies finance numerous products to consumers and other businesses, they must adhere to the Federal Consumer Credit Protection act. This act requires written disclosure of information related to the financing done by the companies.

concentration_points.concentration_title: Rising interest rates are anticipated to slow the concentration
concentration_points.concentration_description: Rising interest rates are anticipated to slow the concentration. Acquiring companies takes a massive amount of capital, capital that is often financed in one way or another. So when interest rates rose during 2022, financing became much more costly, which in turn slowed acquisitions in the industry.

concentration_points.concentration_title: Hiring More Specialized Employees Further Concentrates the Industry
concentration_points.concentration_description: Large stores like Home Depot and Lowes sell a range of products to outfit and improve a home. There are sub-industries that specialize in one specific area of the home, like flooring, lighting, etc. Usually, these stores are in competition with the larger stores. However, big box stores in this industry can leverage their size and capital to secure more specialized employees to run their departments.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: PURCHASES ARE THE HIGHEST COST FOR STORES
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: During COVID-19, upstream manufacturers faced skyrocketing prices for commodities, including plastic and resin manufacturing, a major input for many products sold in this industry. As the pandemic subsides and the supply chain recovers, purchase costs have fallen.

In 2023 wages are anticipated to make up 8.6% of total revenue. Overall growth and activity during the period have kept wages relatively high despite uncertainty. Most of the operations in home improvement stores require employees to merchandise, warehouse products, and maintain the store.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: PROFIT BENEFITED FROM A STRONG HOUSING SECTOR BEFORE 2023
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Profit, measured as earnings before interest and taxes, is expected to account for 14.2% of revenue in 2023. Low interest rates throughout the period resulted in rapid growth in the residential sector. This resulted in heightened demand for home improvement stores, as they saw experienced massive demand. Higher interest rates raised by the Fed have reversed that trend, causing residential improvement and construction projects to falter as borrowing costs become more expensive. As a result, industry profit suffers.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: After the initial capital investment, the industry is largely labor intensive, requiring many people to staff a store for selling, stocking, check out and support services.

The industry is adding new patent technologies at a rate in line with the average across all industries, which suggests a stable addition of technology. However, the concentration of technologies is high. This creates the potential for innovation outside the focus of industry leaders to gain traction.

volatility_points.volatility_title: Strong demand from the residential sector offset other COVID-19-related declines
volatility_points.volatility_description: While the US economy was struggling through COVID-19 and its related disruptions, the residential sector was booming. This resulted in strong demand for home improvement stores coming from the do-it-yourself segment. Due to stay-at-home orders, consumers looked to invest in their homes, resulting in a jumping demand for home improvement stores, along with many other related industries.

volatility_points.volatility_title: Demand plummets as interest rates increase
volatility_points.volatility_description: Home improvement stores rely heavily on demand from the residential sector. Throughout most of the period, low-interest rates have boosted activity in the residential sector. However, to deal with rising inflation rates across the US Economy, the Federal Reserve announced in 2022 that they would be conducting a contractionary monetary policy to reel in inflation. This resulted in rising interest rates which greatly depressed activity in the housing sector and is expected to continue to dampen revenue moving forward.

FAQs.question: What are the key regulations affecting the home improvement industry?
FAQs.answer: The Sherman, Clayton and Robinson-Patman Acts prohibit monopolies and price discrimination and protect smaller independent business owners. The Fair Labor Standards Act covers minimum wage, overtime and working conditions. The Federal Consumer Credit Protection Act requires disclosure of financing information.

FAQs.question: What industry assistance is available?
FAQs.answer: The North American Hardware and Paint Association (NHPA) is a broadly focused association spanning hardware stores, home improvement stores and lumberyards in America. It hosts events and provides training.

FAQs.question: How do companies differentiate themselves in sales and marketing?
FAQs.answer: Companies expand product lines for DIY projects. Smaller niche companies build reputations for specific products. Services like tutorials and rewards programs entice consumers. Promotions and loyalty programs attract customers.

FAQs.question: How does the housing market and economy impact sales?
FAQs.answer: Sales are heavily dependent on the health of the housing market and overall US economy. Consumer trends and the housing market heavily influence the industry, though the COVID-19 pandemic impacted demand differently.

FAQs.question: How do companies retain talented employees?
FAQs.answer: Brick-and-mortar success relies on knowledgeable, helpful in-store staff as the DIY trend increases. Retaining employees with specialized knowledge is important.

FAQs.question: What merger and acquisition activity occurs?
FAQs.answer: Larger companies acquire smaller niche companies to specialize offerings and expand customer reach. Most small retailers are single-store serving a geographic area, so M&A is less common.

FAQs.question: How has technology impacted labor costs?
FAQs.answer: While some automation like self-checkout reduces labor, knowledgeable employees are crucial to assist customers, so wage cost reduction through automation is limited.

FAQs.question: How have companies reacted to online sales?
FAQs.answer: Online sales now account for about 5.0% of sales for the largest players and are anticipated to further outpace brick-and-mortar as customers increasingly shop online.

FAQs.question: How do companies ensure health and safety compliance?
FAQs.answer: Companies must adhere to OSHA regulations. New COVID-19 requirements like PPE and capacity limits impacted profitability by increasing costs and limiting sales.

FAQs.question: How has the pandemic affected profit margins?
FAQs.answer: The pandemic has resulted in fluctuating demand leading to uncertainty in profit margins.

FAQs.question: How do companies compensate for cash flow seasonality?
FAQs.answer: Some operators offer seasonal products like holiday decorations or winter items like snow blowers when construction slows in winter.

FAQs.question: What is important for new hires?
FAQs.answer: Employees knowledgeable about products can recommend the right ones as the DIY trend increases and customers rely on employee advice.

FAQs.question: How do companies differentiate standardized products?
FAQs.answer: Having a wide, expanding product range meets repair and alteration needs. Complimentary services like design help and tutorials assist projects.

FAQs.question: How do companies ensure attractive product presentation?
FAQs.answer: Attractive, clear product displays are important. Operators strategically design layouts grouping related products like plumbing tools near bathroom products.

FAQs.question: How can companies market to new homebuyers?
FAQs.answer: As housing starts increase, demand for home improvement products grows, so companies can market and promote to new homebuyers.

FAQs.question: How does the number of households impact business?
FAQs.answer: An increase in the number of households raises demand for home improvement products.

FAQs.question: How can companies cater to budget-conscious consumers?
FAQs.answer: When consumers undertake home improvement projects, industry revenue grows from both DIY and professional customers purchasing project materials.
